scenes.title: Three-front war, one new lever
scenes.main_point: AI raised expectations, broke distribution, and intensified competition; growth shifted to trust.
scenes.scene_summary: AI raised expectations, collapsed channels, and attacked value props—so growth shifted to trust.
scenes.scene_prompt:
Delicate watercolor painting style, soft washes, visible brush strokes, muted tones.
In a modern marketplace plaza, a business leader stands at a crossroads as three opposing currents swirl: a looming AI presence, crumbling signposts of old distribution channels, and rival figures (incumbent, startup, and customers) pressing in.
The leader reaches toward a simple, steady emblem of trust amid the chaos, expression focused and wary.

scenes.title: Old channels failed; trust channels rose
scenes.main_point: SEO/SEM/corporate social weakened; employee-led, creators, community, and product-led brand built word of mouth.
scenes.scene_summary: SEO, SEM, and corporate social weakened, while people, creators, community, and product built word of mouth.
key_elements: SEO disrupted by AI content and answer engines
Word of mouth as ultimate trust signal
scenes.scene_prompt:
Delicate watercolor painting style, soft washes, visible brush strokes, muted tones.
In the same war-room map setting from scene 1, the strategist watches faded arrows labeled SEO/SEM/corporate social crumble into mist while new hand-drawn paths form from employees, creators, and a community circle around the product.
A warm ripple of word-of-mouth spreads outward, with a small sign reading “Cello referrals” near the growing trust paths.

scenes.title: Retention moat and operating model
scenes.main_point: AI commoditized cheaper/faster value; retention depended on confidence in outcomes and fast, public iteration.
scenes.scene_summary: As AI commoditized utility, customers stayed with products that shipped fast and earned trust.
key_elements: Value prop test: cheaper, more efficient, more effective
Trust as confidence in better outcomes over time
Build in public via founders and builders
Closing warning: channels and value props collapsing faster than expected
scenes.scene_prompt:
Delicate watercolor painting style, soft washes, visible brush strokes, muted tones.
In the same war-room workspace, the founder and a small cross-functional team (product, marketing, customer success) gather around a whiteboard showing a transparent public roadmap and tiny micro-release notes.
They pin customer feedback cards into a loop labeled “trust → outcomes → retention,” hands mid-motion as they commit to rapid iteration, calm resolve on their faces.
